pick up.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to lift something or someone up
pick up.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: He picked up the letter and read it.
The phone rang and I picked it up.
Mummy, can you pick me up?
pick up.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to get up from the ground after you have fallen
pick up.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Carol picked herself up and brushed the dirt off her coat.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to make a room or building tidy
pick up.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: Pick up your room before you go to bed.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: He’s already picked up three major prizes this year.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to buy something or get it from a shop etc
pick up.translation[0].definitions[4].ex: I picked up an evening paper on the way home.
For more details, pick up a leaflet in your local post office.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: I picked up a virus while I was in America.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[6].de: to collect something from a place
pick up.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: I’ll pick my things up later.
She just dropped by to pick up her mail.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[7].de: to let someone get into your car, boat etc and take them somewhere
pick up.translation[0].definitions[7].ex: I’ll pick you up at the station.
The survivors were picked up by fishing boats from nearby villages.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[8].de: to learn something by watching or listening to other people
pick up.translation[0].definitions[8].ex: I picked up a few words of Greek when I was there last year.
Mary watched the other dancers to see if she could pick up any tips.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[9].de: to notice something that is not easy to notice, such as a slight smell or a sign of something
pick up.translation[0].definitions[9].ex: I picked up a faint smell of coffee.
The dogs picked up the scent and raced off.
We picked up their tracks again on the other side of the river.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[10].d: if a machine picks up a sound, movement, or signal, it is able to notice it or receive it
pick up.translation[0].definitions[10].e: The sensors pick up faint vibrations in the earth.
I managed to pick up an American news broadcast.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[11].d: to become friendly with someone you have just met because you want to have sex with them
pick up.translation[0].definitions[11].e: young women sitting around in bars waiting to be picked up
pick up.translation[0].definitions[12].d: if you pick up where you stopped or were interrupted, you start again from that point
pick up.translation[0].definitions[12].e: We’ll meet again in the morning and we can pick up where we left off.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[13].d: if you pick up an idea that has been mentioned, you return to it and develop it further
pick up.translation[0].definitions[13].e: I’d like to pick up what you said earlier.
This same theme is picked up in his later works.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[14].d: if a situation picks up, it improves
pick up.translation[0].definitions[14].e: Her social life was picking up at last.
The economy is finally beginning to pick up again.
We’ve been through a bit of a bad patch, but things are picking up again now.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[15].d: if a medicine or drink picks you up, it makes you feel better
pick up.translation[0].definitions[16].d: if you pick up a road, you go onto it and start driving along it
pick up.translation[0].definitions[16].e: We take the A14 to Birmingham and then pick up the M5.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[17].d: if you pick up a train, bus etc, you get onto it and travel on it
pick up.translation[0].definitions[18].e: The train was gradually picking up speed.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[19].e: Why should the taxpayer pick up the tab for mistakes made by a private company?
pick up.translation[0].definitions[20].d: if the wind picks up, it increases or grows stronger
pick up.translation[0].definitions[21].d: if one thing picks up a colour in something else, it has an amount of the same colour in it so that the two things look nice together
pick up.translation[0].definitions[21].e: I like the way the curtains pick up the red in the rug.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[22].d: if the police pick someone up, they take them somewhere to answer questions or to be locked up
pick up.translation[0].definitions[22].e: He was picked up by police as he was trying to leave the country.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[23].d: to try to make your life normal again after something very bad has happened to you
pick up.translation[0].definitions[23].e: Thousands of victims of the earthquake are now faced with the task of picking up the pieces of their lives.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[24].d: if you pick up the threads of something that you were doing, you try to return to it and start doing it again after it stopped or was changed
pick up.translation[0].definitions[24].e: Now that the war was over they could pick up the threads of their lives again.
pick up.translation[0].definitions[25].d: used to tell someone to walk properly or more quickly
pick up.translation[1].definitions[0].de: a small truck with low sides that is used for carrying goods
pick up.translation[1].definitions[1].de: an improvement in something which will be good for economic success
pick up.translation[1].definitions[1].ex: There are signs of a pick-up in high street spending.
pick up.translation[1].definitions[2].de: an occasion when someone or something is collected from a place
pick up.translation[1].definitions[2].ex: The price includes travel from your local pick-up point in the UK to your hotel in Paris.
pick up.translation[1].definitions[3].de: a stranger that you meet in a bar, at a party etc and have sex with
pick up.translation[1].definitions[4].de: an electronic part on a musical instrument, especially an electric guitar, that makes the sound louder
pick up.translation[1].definitions[5].de: the rate at which a vehicle can increase its speed
pick up.translation[1].definitions[5].ex: It was a small car, but it had good pick-up.
pick up.translation[2].definitions[0].de: if business or trade picks up, it improves
pick up.translation[2].definitions[1].de: to buy something, especially for a low price
pick up.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: Homes here can be picked up for as little as £30,000.
pick up.translation[2].definitions[2].de: to pay for something, especially when it is not your responsibility to pay
pick up.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: The contractors do not want to pick up the bill for problems which are not of their making.
pick up.translation[3].definitions[0].de: an improvement or increase in a type of economic activity
pick up.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: There are signs of a pick-up in high street spending.
pick up.translation[3].definitions[1].de: a small truck with low sides that is used for carrying goods
pick up.translation[3].definitions[2].de: an occasion when someone or something is collected from a place
pick up.translation[3].definitions[2].ex: A pick-up had been arranged for 5.30pm.
